content: f lucky 7 designed by sarah punderson a slouchy hat pattern with instructions for 7 different weights of yarn a simple slip_stitch pattern gives this easy hat a little character you now have one pattern that can be used for any yarn you have because there are instructions for fingering sport dk worsted aran bulky and super bulky weight yarns the weights and yardages used for each hat are included for easy substitution of yarns great for stash busting or handspun yarns included in the pattern are photos a complete list of abbreviations and a stitch glossary experience with knitting in the round is necessary skill level advanced beginner yarn weights fingering sport dk worsted aran bulky & super bulky size one size to fit an average head measurement of 20 inches pattern notes this hat is worked from the bottom up the ribbing is snug measuring about 16 inches at the top of the ribbing unstretched the body of the hat is loose between 21 and 22 inches i have used several indie yarns in my samples the idea is not to use the yarn i used but to be able to use any yarn you want and match it to the appropriate gauge it is better to knit your yarn at a slightly looser gauge than tighter gauge if necessary for extra drape and loose fit typically the gauge of knitting in the round is different than the gauge of knitting flat so it is important to swatch in the round directions below to swatch in the round without knitting in the round with a circular needle cast on desired number of stitches preferably enough to measure 4 inches or more knit one row do not turn your work slide the stitches across the cable and down to the other needle shaft carry the yarn across the back by laying it loosely across your hand and knit the next row continue in this manner until you have
